conversation:
Raphael: There. Middle-of-somewhere.
Karlach: I don't like this at all.
Player: Can you be more specific than 'somewhere'?
Raphael: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.
Raphael: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...
Raphael: ...it might just be your last.
Player: What makes you say that?
Raphael: Call it a ninth sense.
Raphael: What's better than a devil you don't know?
Raphael: A devil you do.
Wyll: Hollering hells - you're a cambion.
Raphael: And so much more.
Raphael: Am I a friend? Potentially. An adversary? Conceivably. But a saviour? That's for certain.
Player: Level your weapon at the creature.
Raphael: My, aren't you a nervous one! I assure you I'm here to help, not harm.
Raphael: Consider your predicament.
Raphael: One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.
Raphael: I could fix it all like that.
NodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.
Player: I'll do anything to get rid of the tadpole.

Raphael: There. Middle-of-somewhere.
Karlach: I don't like this at all.
Player: Take me back. Now.
Raphael: And deny you the honour of my hospitality?
Raphael: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Raphael: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...
Raphael: ...it might just be your last.
Player: I'm getting tired of your games.
Raphael: Fair enough.
Raphael: What's better than a devil you don't know?
Raphael: A devil you do.
Wyll: Hollering hells - you're a cambion.
Raphael: And so much more.
Raphael: Am I a friend? Potentially. An adversary? Conceivably. But a saviour? That's for certain.
Player: Why would you help me?
Raphael: Because my compassion is boundless. I stride among the needy, giving comfort where I can.
Raphael: And you're in dire need. One skull, two tenants, and no solution in sight.
Raphael: I could fix it all like that.
NodeContext: He snaps his fingers on the word 'that'. As he does so, the candle flames suddenly shine unnaturally bright, bathing the scene in a hellish red glow.
Player: I'll do anything to get rid of the tadpole.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Hide Marcus
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel returns to room
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is not in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her out of position, etc.)
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is not in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her out of position, etc.)
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is already in her room.
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
Isobel: You're here for the protection spell, right? Come on - let's get you fit for purpose.
Narrator: *Pain bursts from the wound on your hand. You see yourself kneeling in a dark hall, surrounded by initiates. A female voice preaches against Selûne and all she stands for. You nod, rapt.*
InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memoriy fragment
Isobel: Well! If the Moonmaiden didn't strike me dead for blessing you, she must rather approve of this little alliance.
Isobel: This will block the lesser effects of the shadow curse, allowing you to traverse the darkness outside... should Shar's own protection falter, that is.
Isobel: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.
Player: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.
Isobel: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Hide Marcus
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is already in her room.
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
Isobel: You're here for the protection spell, right? Come on - let's get you fit for purpose.
Narrator: *Pain bursts from the wound on your hand. You see yourself kneeling in a dark hall, surrounded by initiates. A female voice preaches against Selûne and all she stands for. You nod, rapt.*
InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memoriy fragment
Isobel: Well! If the Moonmaiden didn't strike me dead for blessing you, she must rather approve of this little alliance.
Isobel: This will block the lesser effects of the shadow curse, allowing you to traverse the darkness outside... should Shar's own protection falter, that is.
Isobel: Curious. Surely the Nightsinger could have shielded all her followers, and made this place her domain long ago... yet she only acts now, and aids you alone. I wonder why.
Player: That's none of your concern.
Isobel: I suppose you're right.
Isobel: I'll stop needling you, though. You have more important things to do, after all.
Player: I've already been to Moonrise, but I have more work to do indeed.
Isobel: I imagine so, if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing off into the night.
Player: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

Isobel: It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.

Isobel: You... have. Forgive me for gilding the lily. I suppose if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing into the night, there's work to be done there yet.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

Isobel: You're here for the protection spell, right? Come on - let's get you fit for purpose.
Player: Try to understand what's happening.
Narrator: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
Isobel: Well! If the Moonmaiden didn't strike me dead for blessing you, she must rather approve of this little alliance.
Isobel: This will block the lesser effects of the shadow curse, allowing you to traverse the darkness outside... should Shar's own protection falter, that is.
Isobel: Curious. Surely the Nightsinger could have shielded all her followers, and made this place her domain long ago... yet she only acts now, and aids you alone. I wonder why.
Player: I don't know what to make of it myself.
Isobel: I suppose Shar is nothing if not mysterious.
Isobel: I'll stop needling you, though. You have more important things to do, after all.
Player: I've already been to Moonrise, but I have more work to do indeed.
Isobel: I imagine so, if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing off into the night.
Player: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
Player: Careful. I doubt we have the same concept of 'civilised'.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Hold your horses - just hear me out.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: I can give you power. Anything you want!
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: You want to be stronger? Tougher? Smarter? Done! Just let me go. (Ability Score +1)
Karlach: Poisoned deal. Trust me. Don't believe a word she says.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: What'll it be, petal?
Player: Keep your life and your magic. I don't want either.

GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
Player: Careful. I doubt we have the same concept of 'civilised'.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Hold your horses - just hear me out.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: I can give you power. Anything you want!
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: You want to be stronger? Tougher? Smarter? Done! Just let me go. (Ability Score +1)
Karlach: Poisoned deal. Trust me. Don't believe a word she says.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: What'll it be, petal?
Player: You're a vile, monstrous creature. There is no bargain for you but death.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Tch. Doesn't it ever get lonely? Up on that high horse of yours?
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But have it your way. Tell your precious little god I say hello... after I rip out your throat!

GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
Player: What I want is Mayrina - alive and free.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But she's worthless to you!
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Let me leave with the girl, and I'll give you power.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: You want to be stronger? Tougher? Smarter? Done! Anything is possible. (Ability Score +1)
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Just let me keep the girl and her babe.
Karlach: Please! She's dreaming if she thinks we'd leave Mayrina here.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: It's your choice, sweetness.
Player: There's no choice to make. A corrupting force like you has to be destroyed.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Tch. Doesn't it ever get lonely? Up on that high horse of yours?
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But have it your way. Tell your precious little god I say hello... after I rip out your throat!

InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
Isobel: You may be a Sharran, but you'll still be better off in those shadows with my Lady's blessing. Just sit still for a moment, please.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene. (lighting tests in progree for clouds revealing the moon)

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|
Narrator: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*
Shadowheart: Ngh... it hurts...
Isobel: Perfect.
Isobel: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
Isobel: But there are places it won't help - places where the curse is darker. Stronger.
Isobel: The cultists are able to traverse even the deepest shadows, though. I don't know how - the Harpers are trying to figure it out.
Shadowheart: Selûnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
NodeContext: Low-key revulsion
Isobel: Good nose. Like a nasty little terrier.
Player: Very nice of you, but I've been to Moonrise Towers already.
Isobel: You... have. Forgive me for gilding the lily. I suppose if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing into the night, there's work to be done there yet.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.
